definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: Take the first turning on [to] the left.
sentences.chinese: 在第一個拐彎處向左拐。

sentences.english: There is a telephone box on the comer.
sentences.chinese: 在拐彎處有一個電話間。

sentences.english: Take the first turning on the right.
sentences.chinese: 在第一個拐彎處往右拐。

sentences.english: There is a fruit shop at the nest turning.
sentences.chinese: 在下個拐彎處有家水果店。

sentences.english: There is telephone box on the corner.
sentences.chinese: 在拐彎處有一個電話間。

sentences.english: Turn left and it will be on the corner.
They go round the corner and stop the traffic.
sentences.chinese: 他們走到拐彎處，阻止車輛繼續前行。

sentences.english: It's the third house from the corner.
sentences.chinese: 就是從拐彎處數第三棟房子。

sentences.english: He got round the corner out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 他繞過拐彎處便不見了。

sentences.english: There has been a series of car accidents at the next turning.
sentences.chinese: 在下一個拐彎處發生了一連串的車禍。

sentences.english: Take the first turning on the left.
